Consumer complaint narrative: This complaint is written in reference to a Midwest recovery system LLC acct # XXXX listed on my XXXX major credit reports illegally, in regards to a collecting a debt I do not owe. I have sent request for validation via USPS certified mail/ return receipt requested at the beginning of XXXX XXXX. I have not receive any response! According to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, a debt must be 100 % true and accurate. This company has place their name Midwest Recovery Systems acct # XXXX on my XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX reports without validation. The original creditor XXXX whom this company is attempting to collect false funds, have misapplied any payments I may owe. To my understanding I had a checking account with XXXX back in XXXX and I close the account in XXXX, due to limited supply of branches. I wanted to join a bank that was bigger, However, I did not leave the company XXXX with any outstanding balance. Neither was I ever inform of having a balance with them. It has been 6 years since I banked with XXXX whom this company Midwest Recovery System LLC is attempting to collect funds. I have been trying to resolve this matter amicably with this company. Failure to comply to FTC regulations regarding debt collecting and credit reporting will result in a small claims legal action against this company Midwest Recovery Systems at my local venue. I will be seeking a minimum of {$5000.00} in damages for : Defamation, Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud, and Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( including but not limited to Section 807-8 ). This company will be required to appear in a court venue local to me, in order to formally defend themselves. This notice is an attempt to correct this company records, any information received from this company will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. This is a request that this company Midwest Recovery System cease there illegal collection attempt and request removal of there company name from my XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX credit reports immediately. I had a similar case against a collection agency and XXXX whom the collection agency was trying to collect illegal funds. I took them to small claims court and was awarded {$5000.00} from each company. This matter is urgent and should require your immediate attention. I am now prepared to file a small claims judgement against your company. I have been maintaining a careful record of my communication with you for legal purposes only. Dependent upon this company response, I may be detailing any potential issues with this company via an online public press release, including documentation of any potential small claims action. Further more, if this debt was valid, the statue of limitation ( SOL ) expires 6 years in my state. Which is another violation I can file charges against this company Midwest Recovery System. I close this account in XXXX!

Consumer complaint narrative:
on XX/XX/2019 I sent out notarized dispute letters via certified mail to XXXX, XXXX and TransUnion credit bureaus disputing the information with several creditors on my reports. I also sent out letters to the actual creditors, asking both the credit bureaus as well as the creditors for original signed consumer contract as stated in Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the Fair Credit Report Act. 

After no response or verification from either the creditors nor the bureaus, I sent more notarized certified letters out dated XX/XX/2019. Again, I did not get any verification of ANY signed consumer contract as stated in Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the Fair Credit Report Act. 

On XX/XX/2019, after still NO VERIFICATION and NO RESPONSE from either creditor or the Bureaus, I sent another round of letters asking for verification as stated in Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the Fair Credit Report Act. AGAIN FRUSTRATINGLY WITH NO RESPONSE!!! 

On XX/XX/2019, AGAIN,, I sent a final round of letters as a final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding refusal to delete UNVERIFIED information from my consumer file. AGAIN NO RESPONSE!!! 

The unverified accounts on my record have damaged my good name by not allowing me to obtain credit. I know for a fact that all of these letters were delivered and read by all parties they were sent to, and still i had not received any consumer signed contract as verification as stated BY LAW these entities MUST PROVIDE ME. 

I'm past any resolution on this matter and demand that ALL INFORMATION be deleted that was not verified, including all hard inquiries. These supposed creditors and the 3 main credit bureaus have had 81 days to respond to my legal demands and have failed to do so. I'm writing this complaint as an initial request to make this right before I pursue legal action. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a public record & Child Support entry that was placed on my credit report and I have been trying for over 12 months to get this entry removed. I have spoken with numbers representatives, supervisors, and managers in regards to the erroneous public record and I have yet to get it resolved. This is my 14th dispute in which I am currently awaiting results. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called and spoke with a representative and inquired how Equifax, XXXX and XXXX verifies their public records. I want to know this information because the public record keeps coming back as mine. I had 20 representatives that told me that the request/dispute is sent as a message to the courthouse through XXXX. Once the court verifies it, the information is sent back to the credit bureau. I advised that I would like to cancel that dispute and they advised that because the dispute was already sent to the courthouse, I will need to contact them with my name and the case number. Being that I work for a XXXX XXXX, I know the court system and their procedures, but decided to call anyway. 
Contacted the court and they advised that they do no disclose, release or verify any information with the credit bureaus or any 3rd parties. I decided to call Equifax back, spoke with another rep this time and they advised that the information is verified by the runner who goes to the court house. I asked what information does the runner give to the courthouse, and how and what kind of physical information does the runner give back to the credit bureau. They could not answer that, and I requested to speak with the manager. Manager advised since this is a re-investigation, no runner is involved. She advised that they use a form that they send over to the courthouse. I asked what type of form and where is it sent because the courthouse confirmed that they do not verify any information with the bureaus. All 3 major bureaus refuses to give my physical documentation ( whether tangible or electronic ) that they use to verify this these accounts are mine.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/2018, I closed an XXXX XXXX Account. I had been dealing with several issues of identity theft, related to my ex-husband 's theft of my credit cards and personal information. The bills for this card were not going to my address as a result of this. When I was alerted to the debt, I attempted to get the debt consolidated with XXXX XXXX XXXX, an organization I had been working with to pay off the debts accrued by my ex husband, in an effort to repair my credit. XXXX XXXX made it very difficult to consolidate under this program, even though I was able to do this easily with my bank, which had recommended the program as a legitimate non-profit debt consolidation ( not forgiveness ) program. 

I spoke to an XXXX representative and explained the situation to the individual on the phone, stating that I would pay off the debt in full, but that I wanted adverse information about the debt off my credit report, as I had not acquired the debt, nor had I received any indication the debt had been accrued, since the bills were not sent to my address. 

I agreed to a lump sum payoff under the understanding that this adverse information would be removed from my credit report. The cost was substantial to me, around {$10000.00}, but it was worth the price of fixing my credit and moving on from the debts accrued in my name. I was under the impression the individual I spoke with on the phone agreed to these terms. However, several months later, the adverse information is still on my credit report and, in fact, until last month, XXXX XXXX was still reflecting that I had not paid the debt, though I had done so more than a year earlier. 

I am very distressed by this situation, as the identity theft has severely impacted my credit score and made it nearly impossible to move on from my divorce and find a new home for myself and my children. I would like this issue resolved, and for further advice on how to remove other negative items on my report that have been the result of identity theft.

Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers

Consumer complaint narrative:
Point of Grievance : Bad faith business, and seeming " bait and switch ''. AmEx XXXX XXXX promo offered XXXX XXXX XXXX points with a {$2000.00} spend within the first 3 months of signing up. This was *not* honored. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I called American Express with interest in signing up for the XXXX XXXX card. I wanted to know whether I'd a. ) be able to receive the bonus and b. ) if, when I sign up I'd be able to receive the card number to make a purchase immediately. I was told a. ) yes and b. ) they can't guarantee whether I would receive a card number immediately as it's system generated. They asked if I'd like to sign-up over the phone and I told them no, that I would do so online. 

I signed up -- there were no pop ups stating I was not eligible for this promo. Immediately after signing up I signed up for a XXXX XXXX number and after, receiving the card number, on XX/XX/XXXX I booked a weekend at the hilton for over {$2000.00}. 

The card was paid off in full after receiving the first statement. I only have three cards with American Express. I don't " game '' the system and all cards are active and used base on the situation. 

It has been numerous phone calls with AmEx with no resolution. If I was ineligible for the promo I should have been told before my credit was pulled and before I spent any money on the card or hotel. Further -- I should be told exactly why I can not receive the promo. The best I've received is that " it is declined ''. 

This is bad business. It's business done in bad faith if AmEx can not be transparent. And it borders on fraud if it's a " baith and switch '' which is very much seems to be.

I got the gift card today and activated it and they " FORGOT '' to FUND THE CARD! Is such a coincidence even possibly accidental? Here is my original complaint, which I reassert since it is entirely unresolved by this {$0.00} balance, UNFUNDED, gift card. XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a victim of Identity theft and If included a copy of the Identity Theft Affidavit Report that was sent to my Sheriff Department for further investigation. I have a few unknown derogatory accounts caused by identity theft reported by your company on my credit report that I didn't open or obtained any good or services from. I've listed the unknown accounts here alone with their account numbers. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX chargeoff This chargeoff was caused by Identity theft. 
TD BANK USA/XXXX XXXX chargeoff This chargeoff was caused by Identity theft. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX chargeoff This Charge off was caused by Identity Theft. 

As you know, 605B. Block of information resulting from identity theft [ 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ] ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days  after the date of receipt. 
I have enclosed a copy of my IDENTITY THEFT REPORT and Report Number, that has been filed with the Federal Trade Commission. 

The Final Rule contemplates automated reports generated by the FTCs complaint system as being within the scope of the definition of an Identity Theft Report. As a result of these blatantly reckless, wanton, and intentional acts, I have suffered and continue to suffer general and specific damages. Please accept this letter as my demand for the immediate and complete removal of this purported item from my credit reports ( XXXX, XXXX, and the XXXX ).

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was admitted to XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/2017. Documentation as to whether or not I received intravenous contrast dye was poor. Middle record records indicate I received the contrast dye after the procedure was completed. The radiology company administering the test identified an error in their medical record system that they have not corrected. Thus they can not prove objectively that contrast was administered except to look at the radiology films which they have not provided me in a readable format. Despite the radiology company having my correct address and telephone number, I never received any bills at my residence for this service. They then sent the bill to the respondent for debt collection. Despite having the correct address and telephone number for my residence from the radiology company and having access to my credit report, the debt collector made no verifiable attempt to give me a call by telephone or send me a letter. They claim that they sent me a letter via regular mail but they can not prove its being sent or being received. Despite having my correct address and telephone number and access to my credit file, The debt collector continue to call an unrelated individual with the same last name. After not receiving a satisfactory response or payment, they placed the adverse account to my credit report. This caused me to lose a high security job offer worth {$180000.00} in salary annually. 

If the bill is in the road, I would like to pay it. However I expect to be compensated for my damages as a result of the deck collector not providing me with the opportunity to dispute the debt in a timely fashion or providing me with any notice that a debt actually was owed.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Company: Eastern Account Systems of Connecticut, Inc.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened to sue you for very old debt
Consumer complaint narrative: I received a voicemail on Monday XX/XX/XXXX from an " XXXX '' claiming that I had 2 civil complaints against me and that I would be served papers that week. I called the number she left in the voicemail and reached CRS and XXXX. XXXX XXXX took the call. He stated the call was being recorded and to let him finish before speaking or asking questions. He said that I owed a debt from XX/XX/2005 from XXXX XXXX  and that I would be receiving a court summons regarding a theft and fraud investigation. He claimed that I had 3 options : 1 ) To go to court and be responsible for the judgment and court costs 2 ) make payments or 3 ) pay off at a discount and avoid the court. The call occurred during my work shift and created unnecessary panic and anxiety. I gave my debit card number to avoid a court record and was sent and email to sign papers to authorize payment. After the call ended and I calmed down, I performed research on CRS and associated and found many reports of scamming and predatory tactics to collect old debt. I called the court system in my local county as  well as XXXX XXXX and had enough information that this was not legitimate. On XX/XX/XXXX, CRS withdrew {$490.00} without my signed authorization. I called Mr. XXXX to confront him with the situation and call him out with the information I had obtained. He continued to dispute the information XXXX XXXX ( the institution where the debt is owed ) gave me before cutting me off and asking what I wanted. I stated that I want the funds returned to my bank account since I did not sign the papers authorizing them to withdraw. He was going to hang up on me before I could ask when the money would be deposited. He stated today ( XX/XX/XXXX ). I called XXXX XXXX  to confirm the original information I received. I called Mr. XXXX back and stated once again the facts and called him out on the lies. He said " the money had already been refunded and to stop calling. '' He hung up on me. The funds were not returned.

I have repeatedly asked questions to have them answered incompletely or not at all.

Consumer complaint narrative:
We originally opened an account with XXXX in XXXX XXXX for {$550.00} and paid down the account balance extensively during that time up to the point of our daughter being hospitalized for 34 Days including XXXX for a major life-threatening medical issue and tried to pay through mid XXXX but could not make payments due to our daughters extenuating medical condition and financial circumstances due to a major job loss as well. This information was communicated repeatedly to XXXX XXXX and XXXX and was denied the access to receive a Hardship Program under the Credit Card Protection plan which would have released this debt. We were discriminated against in the process because we are XXXX XXXX-Americans and also U.S. Veterans who have served our Country well. Other Majority XXXX citizens are not treated this way and that is a proven fact based on statistics and research in the area of Credit Card Protection and Hardship Programs offered to them as opposed to XXXX XXXXAmerican U.S. Citizens. 

I also reached out to the XXXX XXXX XXXX  who XXXX XXXX sold the account to and raised concerns regarding the account balance and inflated interest rates and late charges which were incorporated into my account illegally. XXXX XXXX utilized false Misrepresentation tactics when they denied us access to the Credit Card Protection Plan and illegally denied us access after I was told to raise the concerns in XXXX when I reached out to them amid my daughter being released from the hospital. I also sent them a letter in XXXX of XXXX as well regarding our financial extenuating circumstances. I also raised the concerns regarding the Credit Card Protection Plan in the portal which were instructed to do by a Customer Service Representative for XXXX XXXX. However, no one reached out to us to resolve my concerns with this matter and it still has not been resolved to this date. 

Also, I requested that Ragan & Ragan Law firm to reach back out to XXXX   regarding a reconciliation account payment register and was denied this information today as well. We do not owe this debt because we were denied access to the Credit Card Protection Plan and we exhibited an extenuating Medical Circumstance regarding our daughter and was denied debt forgiveness, although XXXX and XXXX have forgiven others of their debt even without a Credit Card Protection Program with this type and/other extenuating medical circumstances. They just refused to release ours because we XXXX XXXX-Americans.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative: I received a debt collection notice for a medical debt dated XX/XX/XXXX for the amount of {$1300.00}. I have had previous issues with debts being opened falsely under my name from the years XXXX and I have had a fraud security alert placed on my credit report since last year upon my knowledge of the activity that was taking place. This was before I received a notice from Aargon Agency consequently. After receiving the notice dated XX/XX/XXXX, I replied with a debt validation request dated XX/XX/XXXX requesting the Aargon Agency provide a copy of my signature agreeing to the services. As well, I sent a cease and desist, and requested 30 days to respond to the information provided by the agency and that the debt be withheld from being reported to my credit report during those 30 days. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received the response from the Aargon Agency, dated XX/XX/XXXX. The documents attached were copies of the bill information, as well as personal information such as address, phone number, and social security number, however, the agency did not provide a copy of my signature agreeing to services and billing. This is important seeing as though I have had accounts fraudulently opened under my identity. In my original response to Aargon, I requested a cease and desist from communication for 30 days after their response while investigating the information provided. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a debt collection call without information of who was calling and who they were calling for. I returned the call to inquire and both representatives refused to identify the agency they were calling from and who it was they were calling for. After making repeated calls, the representative giving me the name of XXXX XXXX, revealed he was calling from Aargon Agency. However, Mr. XXXX would not identify who it was he had called for. On XX/XX/XXXX, the debt was updated and reported back to the credit bureau only 28 days from the response of the Aargon Agency. The Aargon Agency violated my cease and desist while all the while not validating the debt that was placed in my name.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, or personal loan
Issue: Was approved for a loan, but didn't receive money
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2019 I requested a loan from SpeedyCash Rapid Cash, LLC in the amount of {$680.00}. 

There was either the option to either pick up payment in store or the funds would be debited to the card that was on file, since I didnt make it to the store by the time given I called the ( XXXX ) number attached on the email to confirm the funds being transferred into my account, in which the rep did relay I will see the payment via direct deposit by the next morning. 

XX/XX/2019 I wake up at XXXX check my account and to my surprise I didnt see a deposit transaction, I thought that it maybe to early and took the representatives word I had spoken to the day before to heart and went about my business. 

At XXXX that same day I checked my account and still no payment, I called the number provided and spoke with a rep and I was told to wait three days before calling back in because in order for the funds to bounce back ( from wherever they were since payment wasnt recieved by me ) and then I could request the payment again. 

In all I have been going back and fourth with this company providing any proof I can to verify I didnt receive payment for a loan I am to this day being held accountable for. 

I have e-mails on my end making numerous attempts to verify any information and at the end of the day for the company to tell me Im responsible for the loan ( even though I didnt receive payment ) because they cant trace where the payment went so their acting as if I did receive funds. 

To me, its absurd that this company is perfectly fine with putting someone in a further financial strain and to be okay with {$680.00} dollars just disappearing ... Nobody knows where it went but I have to pay for it.. 




On the banking end, I online bank with XXXX. Ive also contacted this company in order to figure out where the funds went because when a ACH is initiated the my name and social security number is encrypted in order to verify the correct personal has received payment. 

I have gotten NO WHERE with this company regarding the matter and none of the representatives speak English well enough nor located within the states to understand the currency platform. 

Im incredibly frustrated and really just want this resolved in a fair manner.

Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/2018, I applied for the Capital One Quicksilver credit card that included a 0 % introductory APR for all purchases in the first 15 months of opening the account offer. Shortly thereafter, I received a Capital One Quicksilver credit card in the mail. Upon receiving my second billing statement in XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed I was charged interest for my purchases. When contacting customer services at Capital One, I was advised that eventhough I applied for the credit card that included the 0 % introductory APR offer, I was actually approved for a different Capital One Quicksilver credit card that did not include the 0 % introductory APR offer. 
I was never clearly advised that I was not receiving the credit card that I actually applied for, and since the credit card that I received had the identical name of " Capital One Quicksilver '', I was unaware that interest would be charged on my purchases. I feel this was false advertising and deceitful practices.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX I consolidated my student loans. Navient became the my creditor. First off they said I received a $ XXXXXXXX refund after the consolidation, which I never received or even heard about. 

When I originally had my loans consolidated by the XXXX XXXX XXXX they were $ XXXXXXXX ( approx. ) When I began making payments to Navient, my loans were suddenly over {$80000.00} ( approx ). I have been paying on these loans since XX/XX/XXXX monthly and they haven't decreased at all. 

I called Navient to find out how I could address my student loan debt as my principle amount continued to increase despite payments recommended by Navient. I asked about loan forgiveness because I worked for a non-profit drug and alcohol treatment program as a counselor for many years. I was told that Navient did not offer loan forgiveness. I asked the young woman if there was someone else I could speak to about my options and she told me she was the supervisor and she wished she could help me, she understood my frustration because she had student loans herself she had to pay back. There was nothing they could do for me. I said how can my loans be increasing if I am paying the interest plus principle ( approx $ XXXX. ). She said she didn't know. 

Several months later I called again as I had resigned from my position and was on unemployment. Navient instructed me to get a forbearance on my loans. I did so until I was off unemployment and employed again. They suggested I 2xs that I do an interest only re-payment plan. 


I believe Navient manipulated my ignorance and did not guide me well with repayment options. I believed that Navient misguided me into a forbearance as well as an interest only payment to profit from my ignorance. I further believe that Navient either recorded a refund that they never sent me or that this refund as a result of my loan consolidation was fabricated for their benefit. Finally I believe that Navient hires debt counselors that are not qualified to advise students about their debts to Navient. Taking advantage of students for profit is wrong. 

Thank you for looking into this.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon opening up a Wells Fargo checking account I was asked if I wanted a credit or debit card. I stated my desire for a credit card and sent a debit card. I check with the WF official and was informed that they ordered me a debit card as it offered me additional benefits. I asked about all the other benefits associated with the credit card and was informed that they were identical. 

Upon needing to use a credit card benefit, I was informed that the benefit was not on the debit card. Wells Fargo was contacted and a representive in the Executive Office indicated that there was an internal investigation and the bank was unable to help. 

This is clearly a matter where an employee, a number of years ago, went against my request and unilaterally sent a different card. Then the employee gave assurances that the card benefits were the same between the credit and debit card. 

A consumer should not be the subject of mis-information and the results of the internal investigation should be shared.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative: I XXXX XXXX have made several requests for proof that a creditor once originated with a national financial institution that has FDIC insurance can sell off a debt that is part of a securitized trust. Then these same debt buyers that used to be known as collection agencies could re-assign the debt to a fourth party for collection enforcement. This process of stating that debts are being purchased by a third party and then enforced by a fourth party is the larges scam in America. The U. S. Supreme Court decision in XX/XX/2017 known as XXXX v. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is responsible for this scam. This decision basically states that since a third party purchases the debt, that my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act is VOID. The problem is that almost all unsecured debts are sold off to XXXX XXXX in various traunces in securitized trusts. There simply is no resolution where the debt can be purchased, only that the debt can be assigned for collection purposes. Each financial institution must file a 10Q filing quarterly with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The rules on debts being charged off is with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation through the FDIC Act, Code 5000. A debt can be classified either standard or sub-standard. Debts over 180 days late must go into the sub-standard category and written off on a quarterly 10Q SEC filing. These charge 0ffs usually are submitted in the tens of millions of dollars. So its virtually for these debts to be sold..period. Accordingly, I request full validation proving the debt purchase. Secondly, I will entertain a very low settlement agreement to put my dispute to rest. All of the settlements can be submitted through the CFPB portal email address submitted. I am still within my rights under the FDCPA since proof of a purchase to a third party has never been established.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2018, my intent was to pay off my mortgage with PHH Mortgage. I could not wire funds as my bank was in New York State and I was told I had to come into the office in NY and I am in Florida. I decided to do an e-check for the principal balance, and a follow-up e-check for the remaining daily interest and {$10.00} recording fee. Both payments were put into a suspense account by PHH on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX respectively. They told me they needed 10 business days because the funds were not certified. Payoff figures were for XX/XX/18. I was told by TWO customer service reps that my property taxes ( due XX/XX/XXXX to avoid paying additional tax ) would NOT be paid because of the payoff intent, and that the escrow was frozen. I didn't think this was appropriate as they were not going to post my payments until close to when the tax bill was due ( with discounts ). I waited until XX/XX/XXXX, and processed an e-check for {$7.00}, xxx.xx from my bank to XXXX County Tax Collector in Florida. Today, PHH states that they sent a bulk check on XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX County for the same amount to pay my taxes. PHH says if they were to request the funds back, it would take FOUR MONTHS for me to get my monies back. ( I still have about {$1900.00} left in escrow as well, which they tell me would take about 3 weeks to receive the refund ). I then called XXXX County, and they said they have not yet processed the bulk payment, and would probably do so either XX/XX/XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX. Even though I told them I already paid, and that my mortgage will be paid off today ( they are to apply the suspense payments today to full pay the account ), they refuse to send me the overpayment, and state that it must go back to the payer ( PHH ). XXXX County says it could take 4-6 weeks for the monies to be sent back to PHH. I don't think I should have to wait four months for my money. I am very upset about this.

Consumer complaint narrative: Fidelity National Title Insurance Co. Close Date : XX/XX/2005 Buyer : XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, XXXX Seller : XXXX XXXX, XXXX There are two Incoming Wire Reports that have no account information and no traceable history of where the funds originated from. We have the complete escrow file but these two transfers do not include Bank Routing, ABA Number, Account Numbers, Transaction Summary, Withdrawal Slip or Bank Deposit Slip. The first wire was {$280000.00}. We subpoenaed the bank accounts going out of the purchaser 's account and into the escrow account, but a transfer of funds are not present in either bank accounts. The second wire was for {$560000.00} We subpoenaed the XXXX of the company that supposedly sent the wire and their records say a check/wire for {$560000.00} was sent to escrow. The XXXX and the incoming wire report from the escrow file don't match nor is there any history of where the money comes from. The subpoenaed bank account for the escrow account does not show that {$560000.00} was deposited into the escrow bank account. The escrow co. provided a hand written note on the incoming wire report " {$560000.00} Lender/XXXX XXXX '' but this is not the correct deposit name and amount according to QuickBook details. We have written numerous emails to the escrow co. requesting the history of these two deposits but unfortunately no documentation has been provided. The escrow company claims no traceable history for these deposits because they were in-house Book Transfers / XXXX to XXXX. Our deposit of {$280000.00} was transferred to the escrow bank account and it was also an in-house Book Transfer / XXXX to XXXX the escrow file contains the Transaction Summary, Account numbers, Withdrawal slip and Deposit slip. Why wouldn't the other two Book Transfers include the same details as our Book Transfer? The Arizona Department of Financial Institutions recommended that we file this complaint. They have also requested the escrow co. to provide the account details for these two deposits. The amount in question is {$840000.00} or {$840000.00} ( depending on which total you use ) without any traceable history of where the funds originated from.

I went to a used car dealership on XX/XX/2019 at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX to test out a XXXX  on their lot. Met the salesman, test drove it and I loved it. After three hours of negotiating a contract I was able to get the deal and price I wanted. I signed numerous papers and was told my car would be ready in two days so they could detail it.

Two days later I get a call from the manager telling me the car has numerous leaks and they wont sell it to me now, and that its being put up for auction. I told him my family member is a mechanic and Id like to have him look at it, knowing this already seemed fishy. He told me no and that their reputation stands by it. He said I can look at other cars on the lot and get one of those, I told him no, the XXXX was what I wanted and came for and that they should honor my contract or terminate it. 

He terminated it. Found out he sold the XXXX to another person. Now, I have all these inquiries on my credit report that I can't get a loan approved for it. Many of these inquiries I didn't authorize.

XXXX has a dispute that they believe I owe them money because they paid money to the cooperative that I factually informed them that I did not owe, and the money they paid them the payment states for hazard insurance in XX/XX/XXXX. I informed them in XX/XX/XXXX that I did not owe the cooperative any money, and XXXX stated in XX/XX/XXXX that they would not get ( see attachment ) involved with any dispute between myself and the cooperative as the money alleged by the cooperative to be owing at the time was more than what was owed to XXXX. Furthermore one of the loans was paid off in XX/XX/XXXX ( see XXXX 1098 issued by XXXX -attachment ). Furthermore, I continued to pay both loans ( which is not clear which one if not both are on the credit report as one is depicted as current but still open and the other one is  depicted as 120 days late with the same account number Account # XXXX ) The account with the XX/XX/XXXX open date is the one depicted as late ( Original Balance {$14000.00} with a Balance {$50000.00} ) however both should be closed. I never entered into an agreement to extend additional credit beyond the {$14000.00} owed on the original loan and XXXX has no right to extend such or charge such additional money to the account. I never received notification for what the {$50000.00} is for either. They further have changed my address to a XXXX address which is in fact the address of their attorneys XXXX XXXX further deteriorating my credit. Based upon information and belief it is also where they have been sending all my correspondence, as I have received no correspondence from them since XX/XX/XXXX. Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been having issues with completing the short sale process for my property to relieve myself from the debt and settle what i owe with the lender Specialized Loan Servicing. I followed all their guidelines and steps involving the short sale process and had the auction of my home delayed in order to ensure that i would be able to complete a short sale and get my life back on track. With the help of my realtor we got a buyer to put an offer in which we submitted to them. Around the end of XX/XX/XXXX they agreed to review my short sale and sent out an appraiser to get the value of the house. Their value came back higher than our buyers offer of XXXX. Despite their lower value, they told us they were looking to get XXXX. We immediately went back on the market to look for that value. We were able to get the original buyer to come up to meet their counter, and when we did they refused to review it as they had set an auction date and claimed we did not have enough time to submit it for a review. They claimed they had issues getting into the property a second time which caused some delays in them getting another value, but we never received a call from any appraiser. They finally sent someone on XX/XX/XXXX and my realtor had to meet them out there to make sure they would get in. At this point another auction date was scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX so we were still on a time crunch. They got their value back at the same as it was previously XX/XX/XXXX and asked us to wait til after the holidays for an approval. After the holidays we were told that they were looking to NET XXXX even though their valuation of the property came back at XXXX and said their investor would no longer look at a short sale. I have put a lot of effort into this short sale only for it to be shut down because SLS 's negligence and inability to follow through with the process. Their inconsistency leads me to believe that they never actually entertained our offer, and put us through this process for no reason.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I had a couple of security issues surrounding the house I've lived in for over 25 years recently. So I decided to get security cameras. I had a email from this company so I responded and spoke to a lady who quoted me a price of XXXX dollars for this system. It included so I thought the front and back door camera 's. After the installation they gave you 3 days to cancel, but there was no reason to cancel it was working well. Then I finally got the bill about 30 days later and it was for over 800.00. I was floored. When I called the company they told me that some one would get back to me, no one ever did. The finance company said they went on what XXXX told them and they submitted 800+. When I spoke to someone at XXXX he stated XXXX was for the kit which I thought I was getting, but that I had an extra camera added. The front door camera. I explained to the that this was not within my budget and no one every told be anything about an extra camera I had to pay for or I would have told them to forget it. He told me that I would have to speak to someone in management who would listen to the initial call to see what was said. No one ever contacted me back so I called again. This time I spoke to a very rude lady. I explained that at the time of the sale, I asked the sales person what was better about her company and why I should go with them instead of another company that didn't require any out of pocket for cameras or installation. She was just a very nice person who seemed to be very concerned about my safety, that's how they got me. She told me they had better cameras and she was very comforting. I thought she was trying to help me, I was so concerned about what was going on around my house, that was really all I could think of. The only money this lady spoke of was XXXX. She never told me anything about 800+ dollars, she did say I would get a free camera. I feel like I was baited and switched. When I called again they told me that someone would get back to me with the voice recording of the sales pitch, but no one ever has. They are billing me XXXX a month for this 800.00+ for this equipment. I called today to get the pay off balance and to see where to send the check and they told me there is no place to send the check you have to do it on line. That was it for me. I'm not going to pay them XXXX a month for the rest of my life for this XXXX equipment I'll pay them off, but I just want to know has anybody else had this experience with this company and what if anything can I do. 

Thank You XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Maryland XXXX XXXX

Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, IA XXXX To Whom It May Concern : My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX ; and I am submitting a complaint against Ditech Financial LLC, that holds the mortgage on my manufactured home. I began the purchase of my home in XX/XX/XXXX and made the first payment of {$170.00} in XXXX of the same year. Now, twenty years later, after having paid 237 of 240 payments, my loan is at maturation. One of those last three payments was deferred a few months ago. The other two, I have refused to pay, until I receive the fully itemized account of my payment history, including the amount of the loan ( {$17000.00} ), the fixed rate of interest of 9.5 % ( no idea as to how it has been compounded ) ) ; the amount that has been applied to the interest, and the amount that has been applied to the principal. I made three oral requests in XXXX, and then one by email ( sent XX/XX/XXXX ), as I was finally instructed. On that same day, I was sent a reply from Ditech that my request had been received, and a representative would be in contact with me. 

A representative did indeed call and simply started asking me questions for which the answers were in my written request. I told the representative that I wasn't answering any questions ; that everything was in the email. I then told the person to simply send me the information I had requested ; and then we would talk. This is XX/XX/XXXX, and I have yet to have that requested information sent to me. However, representatives from Ditech continue to call every day, sometimes twice a day. 

Since the date of my first payment, I have paid 237 payments at {$170.00} a payment, for a total of {$40000.00}. That is on a {$17000.00} loan. I would think that my debt would be satisfied ; but Ditech still has me owing {$3400.00}. ( Three home owner 's insurance premiums ( that's another story ) of {$84.00} each, are included in this amount. ) In conclusion, I am of the opinion that my debt has been more than satisfied. I can not know for a certainty, one way or the other, though, without the information I have repeatedly requested. Therefore, I submit this complaint to you in hopes that you will help me resolve this matter.

On XX/XX/2014 I tried to have my credit report freeze with Experian temporarily lifted so I could get a credit increase on my credit card with XXXX XXXX. I repeatedly and tenaciously attempted to do this both online and via telephone. The Experian website offered me a P.I.N. that I could give to my bank to temporarily unlock my credit report, but my bank told me that they could not use a P.I.N., and that I should call Experian for assistance. 

Contacting Experian has been time consuming, frustrating, miserable, fruitless and IMPOSSIBLE! Experian is wasting my time, depriving me of the credit that I deserve, and XXXX me off. The government ought to put Experian out of business tomorrow morning. 

First I had to go on a treasure hunt for a telephone number to contact Experian, because a telephone number is either very well hidden or else nonexistent on the Experian website. I used several telephone numbers that I found on the internet and called them to no avail. Each Experian number I called required me to wade through seemingly endless voice prompts, starting with " For English, press 1 '' which is to accommodate, at my expense, mind you, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

When I finally was finished growing older and older and older and older while wading through computerized voice prompts, the end result for each of the several telephone numbers that I called REPEATEDLY was a recorded message telling me that Experian could not assist me, or words to that effect, along with a monotone apology and a suggestion that I " try again later '', followed by disconnection. This happened every single time! If it is impossible to get help from an Experian computer over the telephone, FORGET ABOUT EVER SPEAKING TO A HUMAN! Not gon na happen!

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I was a victim of fraud and forgery while using my American Express Credit Card. I am writing to plead for assistance from The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and ask for a thorough investigation with American Express, as they are condoning, disregarding and quite frankly encouraging fraudulent behaviors from their vendors/merchants. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, my American Express credit card was charges 11 times for a total amount of {$8800.00} from a merchant named XXXX XXXX. I only authorized/signed for 2 charges - {$190.00} and {$1000.00}. I contacted American Express immediately once I noticed the pending charges. In speaking to the agent/representative, we were convinced the charges were an error as there were numerous and duplicate charges minutes apart from each other. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, all the charges posted and I immediately contacted American Express. The agent explained to me that they will open a billing dispute/inquiry with the merchant and made me feel comfortable that the charges are inaccurate and AMEX will get to the bottom of it. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email with an AMEX Message. The message was a note from the merchant stating that I am a regular customer and a copy of 5 out of 11 receipts. I have never been to this establishment prior to XX/XX/XXXX. I reviewed the receipts and noticed my signature was forged on 4 of the 5 receipts ( the {$190.00} receipt being the only one I signed/authorized ). I did not authorized nor was I aware of the 4 other receipts. None of the descriptions on the receipts decipherable. Once again I immediately contacted AMEX, and explained them the charges were fraudulent and my signature was forged. They transferred me to the Fraud department and I was assured that AMEX is going to initiate a thorough investigation. 

On XXXX XXXX, I called AMEX looking for a status update and an update on the remaining receipts. The agent/representative explained to me the investigation is still pending and they have not received the additional receipts. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I returned a call to the Fraud department as they left me a voicemail. The agent/representative from the Fraud dept. explained to me that the fraud team will not investigate this case because I was present at the establishment with the card. The agent/representative requested I contact customer care to continue to investigate the case. I did not understand how this is not fraud as I did not authorize these charges and my signature was forged. I was told by the agent on XX/XX/XXXX that this was fraud and she transferred me to the fraud team. If this is not fraud I do not know what is Either way, I then contacted customer care again and the agent/representative explained to me that there is not much more AMEX can do for me and to figure out an alternative route. I was so devastated and disappointed with the agent/representative approach and response that I had to end the phone call. I took some time to compose myself from the disappointing way the previous agent/representative address the situation. I called back a few hours later and requested to speak to a supervisor. The supervisor ( XXXX ) came on the line and immediately repeated the same message the previous agent/representative provide me ( there is not much more AMEX can do for me and to figure out an alternative route ) without listening to my concerns. I explained to her that I do not feel this was handled accordingly from AMEX from the very beginning. 
i.e. 
How AMEX allowed 11 simultaneous charges minutes apart from each other There are 4 separate cases/inquires open and the agent/representative could not explain why 4 were open vs 1. They could also not explained why 1 was closed out the other 3 were still open nor can I decipher why The agent/representative agreed this was fraud and transferred me to the Fraud dept., the Fraud dept. did not even investigate the case even though I did not authorize these charges and my signature was forged The agents/representatives and supervisor could not provide me any updates on the case or updates on the remaining receipts on every call I made to customer care.

There was a credit on my account for {$1100.00} ( {$390.00}, {$290.00}, {$290.00} and {$190.00} ). Two agent/representative could not explain the credit and the supervisor ( XXXX ) stated the credit was from the merchant b/c of the duplicated charges. Shortly after this was explained to me, I receive an email stating the credit is being reversed. 
Communication and updates have been poor and inadequate The signatures and handwriting on the receipts are visibly and clearly mismatched ( Please see attached ) At this point, I contacted and engaged the District Attorneys office to notify them of the fraud and unjust business practice from this merchant. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I send an email to a member of the American Express Leadership team, to express my concerns on how American Express has managed and addressed the investigation/matter. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email from an American Express Executive Assistant, stating they have received my email and are reviewing my inquires and concerns. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email from the same American Express Executive Assistant, with an attached resolution letter stating We have extensively researched your concerns and determined all claims were investigated and correctly decisioned, because of the fact I was present at the establishment. Their outcome of all claims resulted in the following credits : {$1900.00} ( Vendor/Merchant entered an incorrect authorization code ), {$500.00} ( tip amount from the {$1500.00} charge ), {$400.00} ( tip amount from the {$1100.00} charge ), and {$80.00} ( tip amount from the {$200.00} charge ).

I responded with my concern that this was not thoroughly and extensively reviewed as they stated. And requested a call to discuss the actions and steps that were taken to extensively research my concerns. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke to the same American Express Executive Assistant, to review and address my concerns. I ask a number of questions and what steps/process were taken regarding how American Express came to their decision. She was very abrupt and refused to answer specific questions. Her common response was You were at the establishment. I explained to her that their vendor/merchant had possession of my American Express Credit Card for the duration of my stay at their business. During that time span, they processed 11 separate simultaneous charges without my authorization. They then provided you 10 receipts with signatures and handwriting that are visibly & clearly mismatched and forged. Because I was at the establishments does not mean I authorized the charges. Below are a few of the concern I attempted to discuss with the American Express Executive Assistant to no avail. 
Why was I, nor the vendor/merchant, not physically contacted ( Called ) during the investigation Did American Express review the Merchants history An explanation of the Charges ( I can not decipher the descriptions on the receipts And the merchant would not return my call ) Why certain tips were credited and not others. 
o Her explanation was, any receipt with an X marked on the line for a tip would be credited. 
o There were receipts with X marked on the tip line that were credited and not credited o She stated she will look into why there was inconsistency on American Express 's part with the credit issued for the tips Why was only one charge of {$1900.00} was credited.

o She states the Vendor/Merchant entered an incorrect authorization code o I requested the purpose and meaning of entering the authorization and she refused to explain it to me.

Why did I not receive all of the requested receipts until weeks/months later from American Express ... I requested them numerous times and they finally provided 10 out of the 11 receipts to me in batches when they clearly had all of them from the beginning. ( I am still missing 1 receipt including the receipt I signed for {$1000.00} ) I received endless inconsistency with the credits provided. I was provided numerous credits on separate occasions and then the credits were removed on separate occasions. As a matter of fact, shortly after my call with the American Express Executive Assistant, where she went through and confirmed my credits, I received notice the same credit is being removed.

Inconsistent messaging form American Express employees o The numerous/separate cases caused inconsistent responses/messages from the customer care agents every time I called in. The Communication and updates were poor and inadequate. Each Customer Care Agents provided me a different and inaccurate update or were not able to provide me any updates at all.

The signatures and handwriting on the receipts are visibly and clearly mismatched ( Please see attached ) How AMEX allowed 11 simultaneous charges minutes apart from each other, while the vendor/merchant had possession of my Credit Card. They provided you 10 receipts with signatures and handwriting that are visibly & clearly mismatched and forged. 


I am pleading with The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter. The fact that American Express accepts/allows this vendor to provide dishonest business practice and fraud to any patron is unacceptable, disturbing and frightening. How can American Express support, allow and accept this merchant to continue to provide unfair, dishonest and fraudulent business practice in our community? 


The Name/Address/Phone of the merchant that committed fraud is : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NY XXXX XXXX Thank you

Consumer complaint narrative: I received money from FEMA in 2013 that was given to Capital One, my mortgage holder. They held it until such time as I paid off my mortgage. They released the funds to me in the form of a check. However, they included my wife 's name in the check. This made the check impossible to deposit at another bank. I sent them the death certificate and information regarding my position as executor of her estate. They never reissued the check and I never received the money. They continued to redirect me to my local branch and I pestered them for it, until they closed. Now they no longer deal in mortgages and I have no idea where the {$30000.00} is.

A forbearance is a LEGAL AGREEMENT that allows the account holder to temporarily stop making federal student loan payments. 

Later on XX/XX/XXXX a 12 month IDR plan was placed on my account. 

In accordance with The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( The law intended to protect consumers from misinformation being used against them ) XXXX  XXXX XXXX is not in adherence due to reporting a 90 day late on my credit file and continuing to keep reporting it even though they are fully aware that my account was under the XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX forbearance completed by employee ID # XXXX.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I tried to get some financial assistance which the company offers during times of hardship. I ask at the outset of the process for the underwriting guidelines so I knew what to expect and how to fill out the application properly. They wouldn't provide the guidelines, nor would they tell me anything about them. I had to resubmit the P & L 6 separate times with 6 separate reps from the company telling me 6 separate things. In the end they denied it because of an obscure underwriting rule that they never told me about even though I had repeatedly asked them to do so. 

My sense is that they offer these assistance programs with no intention of making good on the program. The guidelines were obscure and the representatives were vague and didn't know their own program.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: My husband died on XX/XX/XXXX, or XX/XX/XXXX. He died in his sleep. At the time of his death he had a home mortgage with Wells Fargo Bank. The property involved here was a property left to him by his mother.So even though we lived there the property was considered separate property. At the time of his death, I was not sure weather he had paid the mortgage so on XX/XX/XXXX I went to a Wells Fargo branch and advised them that my husband had died and I wanted to make sure his mortgage had been paid for the month. I requested that they advise the life events division that he had died. They accepted the payment. I advised that I would bring the death certificate when I received it.When I got the death certificate I went to a branch and gave them a copy of the death certificate, again requesting that it be forwarded to the life events division. I also made the XX/XX/XXXX mortgage payment. I also called Wells Fargo and advised that my husband had died and that I was calling about separate property. They would not speak with me because I was not on the loan. I sent them a copy of the death certificate and again requested that someone contact me in reference to me becoming the Successor in Interest on this loan. I continued to make payments until XX/XX/XXXX. When I attempted to make payment in XXXX they advised that they could not take the payment because it was delinquent when he died. I advised that I had been making payments and had requested to be placed on the loan as Successor in Interest. I also advised Wells Fargo that my husband had a minor child when he died and that I was attempting to become his Conservator/guardian so that I could resolve this matter for both our interest in probate court. I again requested the paperwork to begin the Successor in Interest designation. I advised that under Dodd Frank and the CFPB guidance there was NO ability to repay process to become the Successor In Interest. Wells Fargo still would not start the process. I had been in contact with Wells Fargo weekly in reference to the Successor In Interest process. I requested that my request be sent to the legal division because the people I was dealing with did not know what I was referring to. I also gave them the information relating to my stepson 's conservatorship. They sent a letter about reinstating the loan and I advised that this would be included in the Successor in Interest and reminded them that they had refused to take payments from me after XX/XX/XXXX. I again requested to be put on the loan. In XX/XX/XXXX, I received a notice to vacate my home advising that it had been sold on XX/XX/XXXX. I never received any notice of any foreclosure as it related to the property. Nothing came in the mail or was served on the Estate of my husband or to me. I was forced to go to court to stop the eviction. After researching the foreclosure I discovered that the foreclosure had been processed in the name of my deceased Mother in Law. No paperwork appeared in my mailbox relating to my husband! The loan on this case had been in my husbands name since XXXX. It also took him great difficulty to put the loan in his name after his mother 's death. Nothing relating to this loan should have been processed in his Mother 's name after he became the obligatory on the loan. I was forced at great expense to go to Court to stop the eviction. Because I was dealing with Wells Fargo and because of all of the reputational issues relating to the fraud perpetrated against its customers I was able to convince the Judge to dismiss the eviction. I again requested that I be made Successor in Interest. Today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) Wells Fargo advised that they had the legal right to foreclose in my Mother 's in Law name without notice to my husband 's estate or to me.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXt Even a small amount of experience dealing with collection agencies teaches most people that defending a lawsuit from a collection agency isn't exactly rocket science and usually goes something like this : 1. You recieve a summons from the collector.

2. You respond to the summons and show up in court. You demand proof that you owe the debt.

3. The collection agency requests time to come up with proof.

4. The collection agency can not find proof. The judge dismisses the lawsuit. Game over. XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Infiniti Finance on XXXX XXXX reported late payment to my wife 's and my credit history. Actually we are not responsible for the late payment. As per the deal the dealer gave they were supposed to pay the first two payment : the one that you pay during the signing of the lease and the second one which is the one that will be officially billed by the finance department. Dealership forgot and I came to know about this when I went online to pay my bill from XXXX XXXX which I am supposed to pay. The dealership owned up the mistake and paid the one they had to pay. Infiniti finance refused to update the incorrect credit reporting and asked me to submit proofs for all this. I called in created a ticket with customer service and submitted the required docs. Processing time is 6-8 weeks and they don't send you an email with decision you have to keep calling and they will just close it after they make a decision. Since XX/XX/XXXX to this date XX/XX/XXXX I have opened multiple tickets with their customer service. Each time they bring up new issue with the documentations. ie lets say there are five things they wanted in the body of the letter they tell one each time they reject. And finally, one of the customer service agent himself dictated the body of the letter to me so that the dealer can print this in their letter pad and then I can submit it. Now they rejected that also. The dealership clearly states that it was their fault etc but they just will find new issues all the time. As I am typing this the customer service agent I am working with is trying to come up with new wording to cater towards the new rejection reasons from infiniti finance. They are just so painful and so irresponsible. I am not sure why they have to do this even when their own customer service agents says they can not figure the reason why they keep rejecting the letter or the plea to correct the incorrect credit reporting. 

Now latest rejection reason which they didn't tell when they rejected before is that they want the dealership to put in the letter why they made a late payment and why they are agreeing to pay it on my behalf. 

Similar is my experience with another ticket I have with them. I got a parking ticket and I paid on time. They paid it again after I paid it without consulting me. And now they have not recouped the money from the city for months now and I will have to pay the same amount again to infiniti. 

Their investigation takes more than 30 days, I am not being notified of the results, there is difficulty submitting or get details of a dispute etc. I need somebody to help me. They make you feel helpless. Because of this incorrect reporting I got rejected for my wife 's student loan refinancing and finally when we got a refinancing we got a lower rate than we should have as because of all this my credit score went down from 800s to lower 700s.

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
A year ago, my husband XXXX was diagnosed with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX. 
We have worked long and hard to build an exemplary credit history and had a strong credit score of XXXX. We had no late payments and no negative reports. As part of my husbands preparation for treatment, knowing that he wouldnt be able to manage our finances regularly, he set up automatic payments on our {$4500.00} XXXX credit card debt, amounting to {$150.00} per month ( above the minimum ), to continue until he was able to return to health and make further arrangements. 

Unfortunately, without our knowledge, interest on our debt increased and our pre-arranged payments no longer covered our monthly obligation. Thirty- and Sixty days late charges began to accumulate, and as a result, our credit score dropped to XXXX. XXXX XXXX recorded our dropping score, but didnt reflect any issues with XXXX. The cause of the decline was, at first, a mystery. 

As soon as we learned about this situation, just over two weeks ago, we called XXXX to resolve the issue and make arrangements to pay off the balance. We were told the debt was out of their hands and had been sent to collections. 

We spoke to our local branch manager, Mrs. XXXX XXXX, who understood our situation and attempted to solve the problem. She explained our predicament to a relevant supervisor, only to face the same response : We cant do anything. 

Though we can provide proof that we never missed a payment, our credit remains severely damaged. Again, our credit shows no late payments. In fact, our credit report shows no late payments from any of 15 other creditors. Only an insane person would pay everybody else and disregard one creditor. After working years to establish perfect credit, our compromised credit score means we can not refinance our home or pursue our life plans. The direct impact on our lives, however, is far more fundamental. 

Our efforts toward establishing perfect credit are part of our dream to establish a family. I have recently found out that I cant have children of my own. We have been working with the XXXX XXXX adoption agency in XXXX XXXX to adopt a child, that is my life long dream. I was born in XXXX as my father was U.S. Military and my mother XXXX. This low credit score will disqualify us from adoption.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under the law, I am protected. The bureaus can not have information on my credit report that can not be 100 % correct, 100 % validated, original contract with signature proven/on file. This is under the FCRA, FDCP. In addition, I am entitled to {$1000.00} PER offense, PER bureau for defamation of character and then some.

Attached you will find letters I received asking the company to VALIDATE that I have an account with them by sending me a copy of the ORIGINAL CONTRACT BEARING MY SIGNATURE. If they claim the account was requested via the INTERNET, I requested a copy of the video surveillance showing ME filling out the application. If the account was requested by phone, I requested a recording of the phone call. In each letter from the company the state : " WE DO NOT HAVE A PHYSICAL COPY BEARING YOUR SIGNATURE '', " WE 'BELIEVE ' this account was established by YOU. '' Excuse me?? This is not VALIDATION. This is NOT proof that I have an account with you. Some claim they received payments during the time the account was opened. Still no proof. STATEMENTS ARE NOT PROOF OF VALIDATION.

I want these accounts immediately removed from ALL BUREAUS. If the company itself has no proof they can validate that " I '' have an account with them, then the bureaus are also lying and reporting falsely because I hold the document that will prove to a judge in a courthouse, in my venue, that neither the original debtor, the bureau, or XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, ANY collection/third party holds a contract with me. Electronically : no video. Physically : no signature contract. By Phone : no recording of me requesting account. SO TELL ME : HOW IS THIS VERIFIED OR VALIDATED??

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: My XX/XX/XXXX Capital One credit card statement showed my balance was {$3200.00} with a due date of XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I paid the balance in full ( {$3200.00} ). On XX/XX/XXXX, I was assessed an interest charge of {$40.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called Capital One customer service to inquire about the interest charge since I had paid the balance in full by the due date. The first person I spoke to said she could not determine why I got the charge and then consulted with someone else. One hour later ( put on hold numerous times ), the other person told me that interest was charged from the time the statement came out ( XX/XX/XXXX ) until the day it was paid off ( XX/XX/XXXX ). I then asked what the purpose of the due date ( XX/XX/XXXX ) was if interest was going to be charged from the day the statement was sent and not the due date. The rep said I had been under a 0 % interest rate for 12 months but the promo expired on XX/XX/XXXX. I asked how I would've known that interest would've started accumulating that day and not after the due date as it is with most companies?? She advised it should have been in the welcome packet I received in XX/XX/XXXX ( over a year ago ) when I opened the account ; she said they don't provide any notifications on the statements. She refused to remove the interest charge and when I asked to speak to someone else regarding the issue, I was advised I would have to call back and get someone else. I then called back and asked for a supervisor again who also refused to remove the interest charge. I explained I thought it was a deceptive business practice to begin charging interest on the date the statement was sent and not after the due date. I then requested to close my account if that is the way the company operates and is unwilling to credit an interest charge ( that should've never been applied ) for a good customer. They promptly closed my account without trying to retain me. I do not think it is fair for me to have to pay the interest charge and am requesting it be removed. I would've paid the balance in full on the day I received the statement if it was stated that I needed to. I never pay interest fees on any card. I feel the way they are handling this promo and interest rate period is very deceptive and an easy way to get unsuspecting customers to pay an interest charge as soon as the promo ends.

Consumer complaint narrative:
During several dates, I have sent certified mail to the credit bureaus asking them to verify the inaccuracies of the information on the bankruptcy they are reporting. On my report, it lists the liabilities and assets being {$0.00}. This is not accurate and you can see this highlighted on the report attached. On several dates, I received the response from the bureau stating they verified the information. I then sent a letter to the XXXX County Court Clerk 's office asking if they verified the information to the bureaus. They sent me a letter stating that they do not provide information to the bureaus. The XXXX creditor was sent a letter for verification and validation and they have not responded to my request and have exceeded the mandatory 30 day time limit. XXXX XXXX was also contacted and has not sent verification. 

My complaint is this, I challenged the Items based upon the inaccurate reporting of the {$0.00} assets and {$0.00} Liabilities on my report for the BK. Pertaining to the XXXX account, they have not responded to certified mail and confirmed verification and validation of their inaccurate reporting. The XXXX XXXX account jumps instantly into 60 day late reporting mark but does not say a 30 day period was breached. I have also added proof that these bureaus are not doing a true verification and supplying relevant proof while not flippantly dismissing the FCRA mandated rules. The bureaus also refuse to provide and form of evidence there for proving their verification. The Bureaus claimed that they had verified the information, when clearly they could not have for two reasons for the BK, 1 ) it is impossible to have a bankruptcy and  have {$0.00} liabilities and {$0.00} assets reported 2 ) the bureaus claimed they verified the information, yet the source of the information sent me a letter that they do not verify information with the courts. Also, I put a Freeze on my XXXX XXXX report yet they used that agency ( NO third party can verify per FCRA ) as a third party. 

This leads me to conclude that the credit bureaus never conducted a reasonable investigation on this inaccurate information for the BK. For the Rise account they have not responded to my request for validation and verification and time has lapsed past 30 days. 

In my certified mail I also requested they remove any inquiries that are not currently associated to any account. The credit bureaus also said they verified the information but can't provide any proof. If they do have proof they have not provided that to me after many requests. 

I would like to have this inaccurate records removed from my credit report as it is reporting inaccurately and incomplete on my report.

I had been lied to and deceived by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, who had already previously ran my credit on XX/XX/XXXX. I have attempted to contact XXXX, lenders, and credit bureaus, but I have only gotten the runarounds between these entities, with no resolution in sight. I was even told to file a police report from one credit bureau against these lenders if they were not willing to cooperate with me and help me remove unauthorized inquiries from my credit. What's so  disheartening is that after I was lied to by a XXXX rep and he ran my credit against my knowledge and permission, I was told by his boss that he would help me resolve the duplicate and erroneous hard inquiries made into my credit report ; but he flat out lied as well, and that left me with little to no option unfortunately.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email from Chase Bank notifying me that an unauthorized purchase with my Chase Credit Card was made at a XXXX XXXX Store ( # XXXX ) for the amount of {$1600.00} and {$2100.00} ( a total {$3800.00} ). Then and there I realized I have lost my Credit Card. 

I immediately denied making any purchase at any XXXX XXXX Store that day. I was later informed that Chase 's Fraud Department will investigate to determine the validity of the charges. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter informing me that, after a " thorough '' investigation, Chase 's Fraud Department determined that the transactions were valid. Thereafter, I called and spoke with the representative who was in charge of investigating my case. I was informed that because my Credit Card has a chip, and that chip was used for the purchase, then necessarily I must have been the one to  make the purchase! 

Again, I told her I did not make the purchase. Someone who wrongfully took possession of my Credit Card used the card without my authorization, and in the process of said unauthorized use, he or she must have used the chip on the card to make the transactions. How that means that I must have been the one to make the purchases is completely without basis. 

I asked her whether or not she made any attempts to obtain the video surveillance at the XXXX XXXX store in question -- because certainly it will be unequivocal proof that the purchases were made by someone other than me. To which the representative responds that I am the one who is supposed to do so. 

Right after, I attempted to contact the XXXX XXXX store in question. I was told I needed to contact their corporate office 's fraud department, to which they transferred me to. The corporate office then told me that they can not release any videos without the order number of the purchases. Of course, I certainly don't have the order number -- I was not the one to make the purchase, and, therefore, I do not have the receipt or any information as to those purchases. In fact, it's clear that XXXX XXXX was in a better position to obtain the order number than I was -- after all, it's their store and they are the ones to keep records of transactions. 

It is clear Chase 's Fraud Department did not make the alleged " thorough '' investigation. It would appear that all the representative did was make sure that the Credit Card chip was used to make the purchase. This entire dispute revolves around the fact that someone else has possession of my card. He or she will and has undoubtedly used the Credit Card chip to make the purchase. Just because the transactions were made with the Credit Card chip in no way represents that it was made by me, especially given the circumstances that I did not have possession of the Credit Card. 

Now, in addition to this CFPB complaint, I am also filing a police report and a formal complaint with the FTC.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFBP I am filing a complaint against TransUnion for failing to delete inaccurate information reported from various creditors. I wrote a very detailed dispute letter and provided full credit reports to display clearly the errors that were detailed in my writing. I received notification the dispute was complete so I pulled my report on XX/XX/XXXX to see the results. Unfortunately, they simply ignored the questions posed in my letter and did not provide documentation substantiating their position.
